description: Demolition, site work, paving and addition to a mixed-use development in Lighthouse Point, Florida. Completed plans call for the addition of a 1,800-square-foot, one-story above grade library; for the demolition of a library; for site work for a library; sidewalk / parking lot; water / sewer project; and for paving for a sidewalk / parking lot. The City of Lighthouse Point is seeking bids for the construction of a new City Library Addition. The new facility consists of a one-story approximately 1,800 square foot addition with a two-hour connection to the existing Library as part of the existing City Hall Complex. project_name: Administration Building
description: Demolition, site work and addition to a water / sewer project in Arcadia, Florida. Completed plans call for the addition of a water / sewer project; for the demolition of a water / sewer project; and for site work for a water / sewer project.GENERAL DeSoto County is seeking qualified Contractors to perform an expansion of treatment capacity and other auxiliary improvements to the existing DeSoto County Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant (DCR WWTP). The DCR WWTP is an extended aeration facility, located on a 160-acre County owned parcel on SE Highway 31, with a current permitted capacity of 0.950 million gallons per day (MGD) average daily flow. DeSoto County is proceeding with the first phase of the expansion to increase the DCR WWTP treatment and disposal capacity to 1.4 MGD. The adjacent 600-acre sprayfield site used for effluent disposal is presently leased by the County from a private landowner. The Base Scope includes the following proposed improvements: demolition work; site civ
reasoning: The project description focuses exclusively on demolition, site work, and essential infrastructure improvements (water/sewer treatment plant expansion), with no mention of interior construction or building materials.

project_name: Avenue, Fort Pierce, Florida. The work associated with this project consists of construction
description:
Site work and paving for a road / highway in Fort Pierce, Florida. Completed plans call for site work for a road / highway; and for paving for a road / highway. The City of Fort Pierce is requesting bids from FDOT pre-qualified contractors for Florida SUN Trail - Highwayman Trail Gap from Indian Hills Drive to Georgia Avenue, Fort Pierce, Florida. The work associated with this project consists of construction of a 1.4 mile, 12' wide concrete multi-use path, three pedestrian boardwalk bridges, and harmonization of existing features. All inquiries will be in a written format and addressed to the Project Engineer with a copy to the Purchasing Manager: Selena Griffett, P.E. City of Fort Pierce 100 North U.S. #1 Fort Pierce, FL 34950 Phone: (772) 460-6847 Email: sgriffett@cityoffortpierce.com and Latonya Hubbard Purchasing Agent City of Fort Pierce 100 North U.S. #1 Fort Pierce, FL 34950 Fax: (772) 467-3848 Email: purchasing@cityoffortpierce.com
